column4: Is there a way to disable usplash so that I can use splashy instead???? (Gutsy amd64)
id be careful, installing splashy on my machine caused it to corrupt grub unrepairably, i had to do a fresh install
I would think grub and the bootsplash are separate aren't they?
no, splashy is a program that can let you customize the boot loading process (afaik) so it has control of grub settings aswell
I believe your thinking of startup-manager
no im not
splashy should have nothing to do with GRUB
it was just a warning anyways, make a backup first
splashy can let you put a background screen to the grub menu, so it does have access to grub settings

now that you mention.. I have this utility called Kronos that makes images of systems.. so that you can re-image entire systems with current configs.. kinda like firewire imaging on MAC's.. but I usually do it after installing and getting setup before tinkering with things
seriously though.. you might be thinking of Splash Screen Manager
lemme find the site im thinkin of,.,.hang on
i cant find the one i was looking for,.,.but this might interest you -- https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/splashy/+bug/92276
this is some starter info on Splashy http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Splashy
thanks for the link.. ill read on that.

the wiki link u gave me, has a link to the splashy home page, where i found this line -- Make sure that you have “vga=791 splash” as kernel parameters. You can add this to /boot/grub/menu.lst or /etc/lilo.conf. See the FAQ section for more. see "grub"
on the wiki link, go to splashy home page, and follow installation instructions
aye, however I don't use 1024x768 16bit I use a higher bootsplash resolution
that was my prob,. im sure my vga doesnt = 791 so i changed it and it broke my system
my trouble isn't installing splashy.. that's already done along with my theme.. the issue im having is usplash (the ubuntu default) overrides my splashy.. so I need to disable it
i believe its a 'quiet' parameter in the boot line -- here you go -- http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=575708
yes
ill give it a shot then
hope you have better luck then i did
